Package com.developersboard.web.rest.v1

Class AuthRestApi

java.lang.Object
com.developersboard.web.rest.v1.AuthRestApi
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/v1/auth") public class AuthRestApi extends Object
This class attempt to authenticate with AuthenticationManager bean, add authentication object to SecurityContextHolder then Generate JWT token, then return JWT to client.
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • authenticateUser

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.developersboard.web.payload.response.JwtResponseBuilder> authenticateUser (@CookieValue(required=false) String refreshToken, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid com.developersboard.web.payload.request.LoginRequest loginRequest)
      Attempts to authenticate with the provided credentials. If successful, a JWT token is returned with some user details.

      A refresh token is generated and returned as a cookie.

      Parameters:
      refreshToken - The refresh token
      loginRequest - the login request
      Returns:
      the jwt token details

    • refreshToken

      @GetMapping("/refresh-token") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.developersboard.web.payload.response.JwtResponseBuilder> refreshToken (@CookieValue String refreshToken)
      Refreshes the current access token and refresh token accordingly.
      Parameters:
      refreshToken - The refresh token
      Returns:
      the jwt token details

    • logout

      @DeleteMapping("/logout") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.developersboard.web.payload.response.LogoutResponse> logout (javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Logout the user from the system and clear all cookies from request and response.
      Parameters:
      request - the request
      response - the response
      Returns:
      response entity
